title: Add Google Analytics 4 gtag.js snippet to all pages

requirements.summary: Insert the Google Analytics 4 gtag.js snippet (Measurement ID: G-73VJ1TQ3D7) into frontend/index.html immediately after the opening <head> tag
acceptanceCriteria: The gtag.js script tag with src 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-73VJ1TQ3D7' appears as the first child inside <head> in frontend/index.html
The inline gtag configuration script initializing dataLayer and calling gtag('config', 'G-73VJ1TQ3D7') is present immediately after the async gtag.js script tag
No duplicate Google tag snippets exist anywhere in frontend/index.html
All existing head content (SEO meta tags, Open Graph, Twitter Card, Google Fonts, Google Sign-In script) is preserved and unmodified

file_operations.description: Insert the Google Analytics 4 gtag.js snippet immediately after the opening <head> tag. Add two script elements: (1) an async script loading https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-73VJ1TQ3D7, and (2) an inline script that initializes window.dataLayer and calls gtag('js', new Date()) and gtag('config', 'G-73VJ1TQ3D7'). Position these as the first children of the <head> element, before all existing meta tags, title, and other scripts. Ensure no duplicate Google tag snippets exist in the file. Preserve all existing head content including SEO meta tags, Open Graph tags, Twitter Card tags, Google Fonts preconnect/stylesheet links, and the Google Sign-In script.
